questions.question: Q1. What does the frequency response of a system represent?

answers.a: The system's output for a given input signal
answers.c: The steady-state response of a system to sinusoidal inputs of varying frequency
answers.d: The time-domain response of the system to an impulse input

questions.question: Q2. Which of the following is true for the frequency response of a discrete-time system?

answers.a: It is only defined for continuous signals.
answers.b: It is derived by analyzing the system's output for sinusoidal inputs at discrete frequencies.
answers.c: The frequency response can only be determined using the Z-transform.
answers.d: It represents the system's time-domain response to a unit impulse.
